There will be two ballot questions before voters on May 5, 2020. Highlights of the base proposal include extensive academic-focused improvements including energy-conscious upgrades that improve comfort and health in all buildings, improvements to building security, and site work to improve vehicular traffic flow and parking. Worn and outdated components such as lighting, mechanical controls and equipment, and flooring would be replaced as needed. These proposed improvements are intended to extend the life and improve the functionality of our school buildings, enabling them to continue serving our community and students well into the future.

A second proposal on the May ballot requests an additional one mill for improvements benefitting the athletics and fine arts programs, along with additional renovations at the high school site and at Marquette Elementary

There will be two ballot questions before voters on May 5, 2020. Highlights of the base proposal include extensive academic-focused improvements including energy-conscious upgrades that improve comfort and health in all buildings, improvements to building security, and site work to improve vehicular traffic flow and parking. Worn and outdated components such as lighting, mechanical controls and equipment, and flooring would be replaced as needed. These proposed improvements are intended to extend the life and improve the functionality of our school buildings, enabling them to continue serving our community and students well into the future.

A second proposal on the May ballot requests an additional one mill for improvements benefitting the athletics and fine arts programs, along with additional renovations at the high school site and at Marquette Elementary.

You can get more information on both proposals at: https://www.mpsbond2020.com/. Watch for additional updates in the weeks to come!

School bond initiatives allow for school districts to take on large projects that they would otherwise not be able to. A bond functions much like a loan. Bonds are sold to investors to raise funds, and the district pays off these bonds over time through tax dollars. In May of 2020, Muskegon Public Schools is placing a proposal before voters that would secure more than $93 million in funding without raising the current tax rate for our community. A second question would provide an additional $11 million with a one-mill tax increase.

You can get more information on both proposals at: https://www.mpsbond2020.com/. Watch for additional updates in the weeks to come!

post_text: Last week, our 5th grade + 6th grade TWI students from Marquette spent the day at the Winter Sports Complex! Activities included the Luge, sledding, skiing, ice skating, and snowshoeing. Kids cooked hotdogs over the fire and ate lunch at the lodge. Everyone had a fun, exhausting day! Thanks to the Marquette teachers for their participation, as well as the Winter Sports Complex for hosting us again this year. Also, a huge thanks to the Neighborhood Associations of Muskegon for their sponsorship of this amazing day for our kids!

post_text: This past Friday 2nd graders at Marquette had a visit from a puppy named Journey who lives at Pound Buddies! In December, these students raised almost $200 when they started their own small business at school, making and selling dog-tag suckers. As a part of their economics unit in social studies, students learned about small businesses in our community as well as local nonprofits and the role they play. As they earned a profit from their sales, they decided to donate to Pound Buddies! These students purchased three 50 pound bags of dog food, doggie treats, and even some kitty food too! Thanks to Pound Buddies for their visit and to our teachers and students for all their hard work!

post_text: Attention: There was a report of possible gun shots in the ravine area near our property at Muskegon Middle School. As a precaution we placed both Marquette and the Middle School into a soft lock-down. (This secures the perimeter of the building and allows no students outside). The police reported that after investigating there is no credible threat and no confirmation that it was gun shots. We have lifted the soft lock-downs. Please note that student safety is our first and top priority. Thank you
